revised_title: Osteological Analysis of Hyopotamidae: A Study on Anoplotherium and its Evolutionary Context
tldr: The author examines the osteology of the Hyopotamidae family, focusing on the Anoplotherium genus. They argue that Anoplotherium is a reduced and aberrant branch of the Paridigitata family tree, and that its limited number of specific forms and reduced skeletal structure make it an unlikely progenitor for the diverse Miocene and modern Paridigitata.
